Document Run-time Behavior
For example, if a programmer uses an inefficient O(n) method and calls it n times, for huge datasets this will result in a resource-intensive O(n^2) behavior. (Instead, he/she would have better implemented his/her own O(n log n) algorithm, if he/she had known about this.) This inefficiency becomes critical if the implemented function is called "a million times" (e.g. in a Web application) or if it implies that the operator of the software has to purchase a more powerful computer (which often does not really solve the problem).
Simply give efficiency information in the API documentation! Note: This simple pattern might contradict the idea of ​​an interface to describe a functionality independently of the underlying implementation.
